parts.title: Part 1 - Branching
parts.description: In this video you will learn about flow of control and branching which is a fundamental concept in programming

question1.text: What does branching in programming allow us to do?

options.text: Repeat a block of code multiple times
Choose between multiple paths of code execution

question2.text: What happens to the indented lines under an if statement if the condition is False?

question3.text: What does the else statement do in Python?

options.text: Executes when the if condition is True
Executes when the if condition is False

parts.title: Part 2 - Boolean Logic
parts.description: In this video you will learn about checking multiple conditions in branching using elif and boolean logic.

question1.text: In a single if / elif / else branching structure in Python:

options.text: You can have many if, many elif, and many else statements
You can have exactly one if, multiple elif (optional), and at most one else (optional)
You must have exactly one of each: one if, one elif, and one else
You can only use if without elif or else

question2.text: If the first if condition is True, what happens next?

options.text: Python still checks the elif and else parts
Python stops checking other conditions and exits the whole chain
Python skips the if block and runs else

question3.text: In Python, how do the logical operators and and or work?

options.text: and is True if either condition is True; or is True only if both are True
and is True only if both conditions are True; or is True if at least one condition is True
Both and and or always make the condition False
and reverses the condition; or checks for equality
